Comments_List: I learned about theories of Information Structure; in particular, the insights from Craige Robert's Common Ground/Question Under Discussion approach. We worked on the connection of that model to the cognitive basis of our linguistic and non-linguistic systems.
I developed an understanding of approaches to semantics that connect meaning composition to real-life discourse.

Very interesting course all along. The topics helped to think on different ways of conceptualizing language, and questioned assumptions that linguistic theory works with. 

Some discussions became somewhat tangential at moments, but that's sort of deemed to happen when you talk about 'big picture' topics.
